instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.5V_S4: What is 5V_S4? This is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S4” – when you see this, assume the person typing it meant to type “PP5V_S4”.
definitions.PMS_SLP_S4_L: What is PMS_SLP_S4_L? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PMS_SLP_S4_L, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power(SOLVED)
threads.message:
Hi guys,
Have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> here, liquid damage while ago, machine was working fine, suddenly stopped working 2 days ago, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> corrosion on 2 pins, replaced, <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> Pin 5 small corrosion, but all voltages(3.3) present at <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, jtag removed was corroded, <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> looks good, SMC good, small crap around PP3v42 area but all voltages present compared with working board, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> area clean,
PPbus 8.57V, PP3V42 3.4V, <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.3V, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 5V, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> 1.18V - no short 52Kohm's, <SIGNAL>P3V3_S5_REG_L</SIGNAL> 56 ohm tp ground however while charger connected 3.3V present, other areas of the board looks good,
Any hints to go further?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power(SOLVED)
threads.message:
"<CHIP>U6100</CHIP> Pin 5 small corrosion, but all voltages(3.3) present at <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>"
And why do you think this is good???
In fact, means that PCH doesn't read/write the BIOS.
Be aware, do not make wrong assumptions!

Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
But fix the power problem first; you don't have <SIGNAL>5V_S4</SIGNAL>.

Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power(SOLVED)
threads.message: Can not find the issue why <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> is at 1.18V, checked areas where it does go in or is connected with but no luck

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power(SOLVED)
threads.message: If Im trying to bypass SMC now fan spins twice with few second interval  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> goes up to 5V at that time, but no further action unless I trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> pads with tweezers - fan gives little spin everytime.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power(SOLVED)
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PMS_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> goes high twice with few second interval if charger reconnected and then stays on 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power(SOLVED)
threads.message:
Check if all big coils pulse too, including VCORE.
Also check for pulse at pin 3/<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power(SOLVED)
threads.message:
Replaced SMC,
I got it to turn on however now ran into issue with no keyboard/trackpad, opt out keyboard/trackpad/ipd cable - tested logic board into good working housing - issue the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power(SOLVED)
threads.message: No TP/KB before and after logged in macOS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power(SOLVED)
threads.message: No at all, can not even Alt boot or PRam with internal keyboard, however SMC reset works with keyboard.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power(SOLVED)
threads.message: Check power rails at trackpad connector and post <CHIP>U4810</CHIP> voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power(SOLVED)
threads.message: <CHIP>U8000</CHIP> was bad - didn't get <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> this one solved however now missing bluetooth :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power(SOLVED)
threads.message:
Tried another airport card?
Check <CHIP>U3510</CHIP> area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power(SOLVED)
threads.message: Yes tried other card, didn't work, was missing Pin10 compared to good board, replaced <CHIP>U3510</CHIP> and customers wifi turned out bad as well - issue solved, thank you very much for all your input.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power(SOLVED)
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power(SOLVED)
threads.message: Yes it works, no further issues found.
